result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph O Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph O Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph O Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following:  
Count #1: 
Jail:  44 days. Time Served.  Credit for 44 days. 
Court Costs Waived.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Joseph O Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests to meet with his client and go over paperwork and proceed to plea/sentencing on 10/06. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with co actor victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Joseph O Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
